content.description: Climb through an overhangÂ down low and finish on jugs.
content.location: In the center of the wall. Start in the vertical gold streak left of the black section (Centurion) and right of the black/gold striped section (Ceasar's).

content.description: Great climbing through the bottom section with a sequence stumper at the top.  Kirk Douglas would be proud.
content.location: just to the right of Comotus.

content.description: Take the right angling seam to the top and finish at common anchors with Optimus Prime.
A very low first bolt marks the delicate crux to this route which ends with easier climbing and a shared anchor with Sentinel Prime.
content.location: Between Sentinel Prime and Acree Prime

content.description: Climb Commodus or Spartacus and continue onto the ledge. From here, work big positive holds up and right out the steep prow. At the lip of the roof, make a very strenuous clip or commit to an intimidating dynamic move to a bucket and then clip.  Hike your feet up above the roof and traverse left to the anchor.

content.protection: Camalots .75-2. 2 bolt anchor on the left side of the dihedral.

content.description: The left angling crack that cuts through the right side of Be Gay route. Can link up with Be Gay route to finish on bolts or can traverse over to a tree to rap down.
content.protection: No anchors. Small to hand size gear works.
content.location: Left of dihedral crack (Gaius) and follows crack on slab. Obvious 5.4 route.

content.description: Great arete climbing with a few thin moves.
content.location: The far left of Roman wall, obvious arete.

content.description: Long reach sequence down low leads to easier climbing.
content.location: The left-most route in the black section of the main wall. Just right of the vertical gold stripe (Sybarite), and right of Boronocus.

content.description: Start on the vertical bottom section past some great features to a large ledge. Continue on crimps to the crux right before the anchor. Good climbing and a fun route.
content.protection: Nine bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The fourth bolted route from the right hand side of the Roman Wall.

content.description: Climb the first section of Ceasar's toss salad then finish the last overhanging half on Boronocus's anchors.
content.location: Roman Wall.  Start on Ceasar's Toss Salad

content.description: Great route with classic crimping through the face and finish on the overhang.

Route name has been amended to a more inclusive (less offensive) name via public requests and approval of HCR staff. 

 This is a sustained and good quality route, except the short flaky ledge system halfway up. Be gentle.

 Climb the sweet slab up to the ledge. The last half of the route is steep sustained face climbing with very safe fall potentials, so go for those anchors.
content.location: This is the bolted route in the alcove just left of Commodus.

content.description: This climb is the "Jugfest". Fun warm up route. Crux is the first 10 feet. Above that point large jug formations guide you through the bolts and to the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts with fixed anchors at the top.
content.location: Located at the right end of the wall, second from the end.

content.description: Climb the chickenheads up the right side of the the Roman Wall.
content.location: Just to the right of Aphrodite, the right-most on the main Roman wall before it wraps around to New Roman Wall.

content.description: Great concentration of 5.10 and 5.11 routes, some of the more high quality routes at the Ranch. Gets afternoon sun.
